page.title: 09Farming
page.content: The area is farmed from eight farms, seven of which have their main buildings within the grid. The area once supported many more smaller farms, the names of which remain as house names or names of areas. West Lane Farm, Wellfield Farm and Greatfield Farm are owned by the Basingstoke and Deane District Council and are farmed by tenant farmers. Manor Farm is part of a major consortium, the rest are independants. The farming is a mixture of arable and dairy husbandry. There are fields for grazing and fields of sown grass for silage and hay. The dairy herds are generally Fresian. The farms grow winter and spring barley for malting and cattle food. Wheat is grown for bread, biscuits and cattle food. There are also vegetable crops such as peas and broad beans grown.
